meanings.definition: A person who excavates, especially as a profession.
meanings.sent1: The excavators carefully dug up the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The excavators were hired to dig a foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The excavators joked about finding buried treasure while digging.
meanings.sent4: The excavators unearthed stories of the past with each shovel of dirt.
meanings.sent5: The excavators' expertise in digging made them valuable members of the team.

meanings.definition: A machine used for digging or moving earth.
meanings.sent1: The excavators on the construction site were busy moving soil.
meanings.sent2: The excavators made quick work of clearing the land for the project.
meanings.sent3: The excavators hummed as they dug into the ground, like giant metal moles.
meanings.sent4: The excavators tore through the earth with mechanical precision.
meanings.sent5: The excavators' powerful arms scooped up dirt effortlessly.

meanings.definition: An archaeological tool used for uncovering artifacts.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully used the excavators to reveal the hidden relics.
meanings.sent2: The delicate excavators gently brushed away the dirt from the ancient pottery.
meanings.sent3: The excavators in the museum were miniature replicas of the real ones.
meanings.sent4: The excavators delicately unearthed the fossil without causing damage.
meanings.sent5: The tiny excavators revealed a whole new layer of history beneath the surface.
